trans-unit.source: Using the Oracle Database Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Oracle Database Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Oracle Database Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Oracle Database Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Connect to an on-premises Oracle Database server to create and change your information or data.
trans-unit.target: Connect to an on-premises Oracle Database server to create and change your information or data.

trans-unit.source: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps to retrieve, process, or push data as a part of a "workflow".
trans-unit.target: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps to retrieve, process, or push data as a part of a "workflow".

trans-unit.source: When you use the Oracle Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Oracle Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Expose a section of the data residing in your Oracle database using a web or mobile application.
trans-unit.target: Expose a section of the data residing in your Oracle database using a web or mobile application.

trans-unit.source: Insert data into your Oracle database table for storage.
trans-unit.target: Insert data into your Oracle database table for storage.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can enter employee records, update sales orders, and so on.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can enter employee records, update sales orders, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Get data from Oracle and use it in a business process.
trans-unit.target: Get data from Oracle and use it in a business process.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can get customer records and put those customer records in SalesForce.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can get customer records and put those customer records in SalesForce.

trans-unit.source: Triggers are events that happen.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are events that happen.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result of the trigger.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result of the trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.

trans-unit.source: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.
trans-unit.target: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.

trans-unit.source: The Oracle Database Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The Oracle Database Connector can be used as a trigger or an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: For every table included in your package settings (more on that later in this topic), there is a set of JSON actions and a set of XML actions.
trans-unit.target: For every table included in your package settings (more on that later in this topic), there is a set of JSON actions and a set of XML actions.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an XML trigger or action, you can use the <linkText>Transform API App</linkText><title></title> to convert data into another XML data format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an XML trigger or action, you can use the <linkText>Transform API App</linkText><title></title> to convert data into another XML data format.

trans-unit.source: The Oracle Database Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The Oracle Database Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: Poll Data
trans-unit.target: Poll Data

trans-unit.source:
• Insert Into Table
  • Update Table
  • Select From Table
  • Delete From Table
  • Call Stored Procedure
trans-unit.target:
• Insert Into Table
  • Update Table
  • Select From Table
  • Delete From Table
  • Call Stored Procedure

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Select API Apps and search for “Oracle Database Connector”.
trans-unit.target: Select API Apps and search for “Oracle Database Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following package settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following package settings:

trans-unit.source: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Data Source | Yes | A data source (net service) name that is specified in the tnsnames.ora file on the computer where the Oracle client is installed.
trans-unit.target: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- Data Source | Yes | A data source (net service) name that is specified in the tnsnames.ora file on the computer where the Oracle client is installed.

trans-unit.source: For information about data source names and tnsnames.ora, see <linkText>Configuring the Oracle Client</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about data source names and tnsnames.ora, see <linkText>Configuring the Oracle Client</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: User Name | Yes | Enter a user name to connect to the Oracle server.
trans-unit.target: User Name | Yes | Enter a user name to connect to the Oracle server.

trans-unit.source: Password | Yes | Enter the user name password.
trans-unit.target: Password | Yes | Enter the user name password.

trans-unit.source:
Service Bus Connection String | Yes | If you're connecting to on-premises, enter the Service Bus relay connection string.

Using the Hybrid Connection Manager
Service Bus Pricing Tables | No | Enter the tables in the database that are allowed to be modified by the connector.
trans-unit.target:
Service Bus Connection String | Yes | If you're connecting to on-premises, enter the Service Bus relay connection string.

Using the Hybrid Connection Manager
Service Bus Pricing Tables | No | Enter the tables in the database that are allowed to be modified by the connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter OrdersTable,EmployeeTable.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter OrdersTable,EmployeeTable.

trans-unit.source: Stored Procedures | No | Enter the stored procedures in the database that can be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Stored Procedures | No | Enter the stored procedures in the database that can be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter IsEmployeeEligible,CalculateOrderDiscount.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter IsEmployeeEligible,CalculateOrderDiscount.

trans-unit.source: Functions | No | Enter the functions in the database that can be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Functions | No | Enter the functions in the database that can be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter IsEmployeeEligible,CalculateOrderDiscount.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter IsEmployeeEligible,CalculateOrderDiscount.

trans-unit.source: Package Entities | No | Enter the packages in the database that can be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: Package Entities | No | Enter the packages in the database that can be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter PackageOrderProcessing.CompleteOrder,PackageOrderProcessing.GenerateBill.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter PackageOrderProcessing.CompleteOrder,PackageOrderProcessing.GenerateBill.

trans-unit.source: Data Available Statement | No | Enter the statement to determine whether any data is available for polling.
trans-unit.target: Data Available Statement | No | Enter the statement to determine whether any data is available for polling.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter SELECT * from table_name.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter SELECT * from table_name.

trans-unit.source: Poll Type | No | Enter the polling type.
trans-unit.target: Poll Type | No | Enter the polling type.

trans-unit.source: The allowed values are "Select", "Procedure", "Function" and "Package".
trans-unit.target: The allowed values are "Select", "Procedure", "Function" and "Package".

trans-unit.source: Poll Statement | No | Enter the statement to poll the Oracle Server database.
trans-unit.target: Poll Statement | No | Enter the statement to poll the Oracle Server database.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter SELECT * from table_name.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter SELECT * from table_name.

trans-unit.source: Post Poll Statement | No | Enter the statement to execute after the poll.
trans-unit.target: Post Poll Statement | No | Enter the statement to execute after the poll.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter DELETE * from table_name.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter DELETE * from table_name.

trans-unit.source: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When complete, the Package Settings look similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Let's look at a simple logic app that polls data from a Oracle table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.
trans-unit.target: Let's look at a simple logic app that polls data from a Oracle table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.

trans-unit.source: When creating or editing a logic app, select the Oracle Connector you created as the trigger.
trans-unit.target: When creating or editing a logic app, select the Oracle Connector you created as the trigger.

trans-unit.source: This lists the available triggers: Poll Data (JSON) and Poll Data (XML):
trans-unit.target: This lists the available triggers: Poll Data (JSON) and Poll Data (XML):

trans-unit.source: Select the Poll Data (JSON) trigger, enter the frequency, and click the ✓:
trans-unit.target: Select the Poll Data (JSON) trigger, enter the frequency, and click the ✓:

trans-unit.source: The trigger now appears as configured in the logic app.
trans-unit.target: The trigger now appears as configured in the logic app.

trans-unit.source: The output(s) of the trigger is shown and can be used as inputs in any subsequent actions:
trans-unit.target: The output(s) of the trigger is shown and can be used as inputs in any subsequent actions:

trans-unit.source: Using our simple logic app that polls data from an Oracle table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.
trans-unit.target: Using our simple logic app that polls data from an Oracle table, adds the data in another table, and updates the data.

trans-unit.source: To use the Oracle Connector as an action, enter the name of the Tables and/or Stored Procedures you entered when you created the Oracle Connector:
trans-unit.target: To use the Oracle Connector as an action, enter the name of the Tables and/or Stored Procedures you entered when you created the Oracle Connector:

trans-unit.source: Select the same Oracle connector from gallery as an action.
trans-unit.target: Select the same Oracle connector from gallery as an action.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the Insert actions, like Insert Into TempEmployeeDetails (JSON):
trans-unit.target: Select one of the Insert actions, like Insert Into TempEmployeeDetails (JSON):

trans-unit.source: Enter the input values of the record to be inserted, and click on the ✓:
trans-unit.target: Enter the input values of the record to be inserted, and click on the ✓:

trans-unit.source: From the gallery, select the same Oracle connector you created.
trans-unit.target: From the gallery, select the same Oracle connector you created.

trans-unit.source: As an action, select the Update action on the same table, like Update TempEmployeeDetails:
trans-unit.target: As an action, select the Update action on the same table, like Update TempEmployeeDetails:

trans-unit.source: Enter the input values for the update action, and click on the ✓:
trans-unit.target: Enter the input values for the update action, and click on the ✓:

trans-unit.source: You can test the logic app by adding a new record in the table that is being polled.
trans-unit.target: You can test the logic app by adding a new record in the table that is being polled.

trans-unit.source: This step is required only if you are using Oracle on-premises behind your firewall.
trans-unit.target: This step is required only if you are using Oracle on-premises behind your firewall.

trans-unit.source: App Service uses the Hybrid Configuration Manager to connect securely to your on-premises system.
trans-unit.target: App Service uses the Hybrid Configuration Manager to connect securely to your on-premises system.

trans-unit.source: If you're connector uses an on-premises Oracle, the Hybrid Connection Manager is required.
trans-unit.target: If you're connector uses an on-premises Oracle, the Hybrid Connection Manager is required.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Using the Hybrid Connection Manager</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Using the Hybrid Connection Manager</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
